status: Legacy monolith being decomposed into microservices (workers/)

external_dependencies.name: Stripe
external_dependencies.current_usage: Marketplace payouts, subscription billing, Stripe Connect
external_dependencies.notes: Essential for payments. Stripe Connect required for marketplace. No viable alternative.
external_dependencies.recommendation: Keep Stripe - no internal replacement possible for payment processing

external_dependencies.name: WorkOS
external_dependencies.current_usage: SSO, Directory Sync (SCIM), Audit Logs, OAuth, Organization management
external_dependencies.estimated_effort: 3-5 days (implement SSO, SCIM, audit logs internally)
external_dependencies.cost: Free up to 1M MAU, then $0.05 per MAU/month
external_dependencies.notes: Currently used for enterprise SSO (SAML, OIDC), directory sync, and audit logs. workers/auth has basic GitHub OAuth + API keys but lacks enterprise features.
external_dependencies.recommendation: Migrate basic auth to workers/auth, keep WorkOS for enterprise SSO/SCIM features or build internal SAML/OIDC

external_dependencies.name: Resend
external_dependencies.current_usage: Transactional emails, email routing, webhook tracking
external_dependencies.notes: workers/email service already implements Resend integration. Email routing configured in Cloudflare Dashboard.
external_dependencies.recommendation: Keep Resend via workers/email - excellent value, reliable delivery

external_dependencies.name: OpenAI
external_dependencies.current_usage: Chat completions, embeddings, batch API, realtime API, webhooks
external_dependencies.estimated_effort: 0 days (already abstracted via ai-generation, ai-embeddings packages)
external_dependencies.cost: Pay per token (GPT-4: $30/1M input tokens, $60/1M output tokens)
external_dependencies.notes: Foundation packages (ai-generation, ai-embeddings, ai-chat, ai-models) provide abstraction. Batch API used for bulk generations. Workers AI cheaper but fewer models.
external_dependencies.recommendation: Keep OpenAI for advanced models, use Workers AI for simple tasks (already supported via foundation packages)

external_dependencies.name: Anthropic
external_dependencies.cost: Pay per token (Claude 3.5 Sonnet: $3/1M input tokens, $15/1M output tokens)
external_dependencies.notes: Used for Claude Code DO, batch processing, and AI generation. Abstracted via ai-generation foundation package.
external_dependencies.recommendation: Keep Anthropic - best-in-class reasoning, already integrated via foundation packages

external_dependencies.name: GitHub
external_dependencies.current_usage: OAuth, package data (npm registry proxy), repo.do webhook integration
external_dependencies.notes: GitHub OAuth for authentication, REST API for repository data. workers/webhooks handles GitHub webhooks.
external_dependencies.recommendation: Keep GitHub API - free tier sufficient, workers/webhooks already handles webhooks

external_dependencies.name: Browserbase
external_dependencies.current_usage: Cloud browser sessions for Playwright/Puppeteer automation
external_dependencies.cost: Browserbase: $49/mo for 100 sessions. CF Browser Rendering: $5/million requests
external_dependencies.notes: Cloudflare Browser Rendering binding already configured in wrangler.jsonc. Can migrate Browserbase client to use Puppeteer with CF Browser Rendering.
external_dependencies.recommendation: Migrate to Cloudflare Browser Rendering - dramatically cheaper, already configured

external_dependencies.name: Firecrawl
external_dependencies.current_usage: AI-powered web scraping, LLM-ready markdown conversion, structured extraction
external_dependencies.internal_equivalent: Cloudflare Browser Rendering + custom scraping logic
external_dependencies.estimated_effort: 3-5 days (build scraping service with CF Browser Rendering)
external_dependencies.cost: Firecrawl: $200/mo for 1,000 scrapes. CF Browser Rendering: $5/million requests
external_dependencies.notes: Firecrawl provides AI-powered content extraction and LLM-ready markdown. Can replicate with CF Browser Rendering + custom extraction logic.
external_dependencies.recommendation: Build internal scraping service using Cloudflare Browser Rendering - much cheaper at scale

external_dependencies.name: VAPI
external_dependencies.estimated_effort: 0 days (keep VAPI) or 10-15 days (build voice pipeline)
external_dependencies.notes: Voice AI with phone numbers, transcription, and AI responses. Complex to replicate (needs Twilio/Plivo + speech-to-text + LLM + text-to-speech).
external_dependencies.recommendation: Keep VAPI - building voice pipeline is complex and time-consuming

external_dependencies.name: Stedi
external_dependencies.current_usage: EDI transaction processing (850, 856, 810), webhook integration, EPCIS conversion
external_dependencies.estimated_effort: 0 days (keep Stedi) or 15-20 days (build EDI parser)
external_dependencies.notes: EDI is complex B2B standard. Stedi handles parsing, validation, and conversion. Building internal EDI parser is non-trivial.
external_dependencies.recommendation: Keep Stedi - EDI is niche, building internal parser not worth effort unless high volume

external_dependencies.name: Composio
external_dependencies.estimated_effort: 0 days (keep Composio) or variable (depends on integrations needed)
external_dependencies.notes: Integration platform similar to Zapier. workers/webhooks handles incoming webhooks but Composio provides app connectors.
external_dependencies.recommendation: Evaluate usage - if low usage, keep Composio. If high usage, build specific integrations internally.

external_dependencies.name: Zapier
external_dependencies.cost: Free tier: 100 tasks/month. Paid: $19.99/mo for 750 tasks
external_dependencies.notes: Used for importing Zapier's integration catalog and handling Zapier webhooks. workers/webhooks handles incoming webhooks.
external_dependencies.recommendation: Keep Zapier for catalog import - free tier sufficient. Build specific integrations internally if needed.

external_dependencies.name: npm Registry API
external_dependencies.notes: Public npm registry API for package metadata. No rate limits for reasonable usage.
external_dependencies.recommendation: Keep npm API - free and reliable

external_dependencies.name: PyPI API
external_dependencies.notes: Public PyPI API for Python package metadata. No rate limits for reasonable usage.
external_dependencies.recommendation: Keep PyPI API - free and reliable

external_dependencies.name: Schema.org
external_dependencies.current_usage: Schema.org vocabulary import and type definitions
external_dependencies.notes: Public Schema.org vocabulary. Essential for type system. Import once and cache.
external_dependencies.recommendation: Keep Schema.org import - free, standard vocabulary

external_dependencies.name: O*NET Web Services
external_dependencies.notes: U.S. Department of Labor O*NET database. Authoritative occupation data. Import and cache.
external_dependencies.recommendation: Keep O*NET import - free, authoritative data

external_dependencies.name: NAICS API
external_dependencies.notes: U.S. Census Bureau NAICS classification. Standard industry taxonomy. Import and cache.
external_dependencies.recommendation: Keep NAICS import - free, standard taxonomy

external_dependencies.name: Google AI (Gemini)
external_dependencies.cost: Pay per token (Gemini 1.5 Flash: $0.075/1M input tokens, $0.30/1M output tokens)
external_dependencies.notes: Optional provider for batch processing. Already abstracted via ai-generation foundation package.
external_dependencies.recommendation: Keep as optional provider - competitive pricing, multimodal capabilities

external_dependencies.name: Cloudflare Workers AI
external_dependencies.current_usage: Text generation, embeddings (multiple models), image generation
external_dependencies.notes: Native Cloudflare AI. 5 embedding models, 10+ LLMs including Llama 3.1. Already integrated via ai-generation and ai-embeddings packages.
external_dependencies.recommendation: Use Workers AI for cost-sensitive workloads - 10-100x cheaper than OpenAI/Anthropic

immediate_actions.action: Migrate Browserbase to Cloudflare Browser Rendering
immediate_actions.notes: Browser Rendering binding already configured in wrangler.jsonc. Minimal code changes needed.

immediate_actions.action: Build internal scraping service to replace Firecrawl
immediate_actions.notes: Use Cloudflare Browser Rendering + custom extraction logic. More control over scraping behavior.

evaluate_usage.notes: If enterprise SSO not heavily used, migrate to workers/auth. If enterprise features needed, keep WorkOS.
If low usage, keep Composio. If high usage, build specific integrations with workers/webhooks.
If voice features critical, keep VAPI. If experimental, consider deprecating.
If low volume, keep Stedi. If high volume, consider building EDI parser (15-20 days).

keep_as_is.reason: Essential for payments, no viable alternative
Excellent value, reliable delivery, already integrated via workers/email
Best models, already abstracted via foundation packages, use Workers AI for simple tasks
Best reasoning, already abstracted via foundation packages
Native service, extremely cheap, already integrated
Free public APIs for data import, cache locally

optimized_monthly_cost_estimate.openai: Variable ($500-5,000/mo, use Workers AI for simple tasks)

cost_analysis.potential_savings: $300-3,000/mo by migrating to Cloudflare native services

core_services: gateway - API routing and rate limiting
schedule - Cron jobs and scheduled tasks
webhooks - External webhook handling (Stripe, WorkOS, GitHub, Resend)
workers_services_available.notes: All core services deployed and production-ready. Can expand to add scraping, browser, and integration services.
